ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was my first art history course, and I learned a great deal about visual analysis and the intersections between art history and politics, sociology, and history.
I learned about 1960s pop culture, movements, and events through the lens of art history, and how these ideas and practices resonate beyond the 60s.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was one of the best classes that Ive taken at Yale- all strengths!
Topics were very interesting, structure of having lecture first and then presentation was nice to break up long class
I don't think this course honestly had weaknesses! It was engaging, well-organized, well-taught, full of interesting topics and readings, and left me with concrete skills and new knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely- Professor Lee is so smart, eloquent, and informed about the topics in this class that it is a must-take!
Yes, I feel like I have a much better understanding of the 60s with regards to more than just art

I cannot recommend this class highly enough. If you are even slightly considering this class, PLEASE apply and take it if you get in. I took this as a second-semester senior, and I can absolutely say that this was in my top 3 best Yale classes of my entire time in college. I will say that I think this is especially true because this was my first/only art history class. If you have no prior experience in art history, this is a perfect class -- it will make you feel on top of the world, with the sheer volume of knowledge and information you learn! Be prepared to walk into any contemporary art gallery and KNOW what you are talking about.

Yes! Pamela Lee is a great professor and she has such a wonderful way of presenting information in an engaging way. Her knowledge on the subjects are very clear, and her enthusiasm for the course made everyone in the seminar grow invested as well. The Washington DC trip was also very meaningful. We were able to see many artworks in person and learned about pieces for our final paper.
